dataset.title: Forest composition before and after forest fire at Kolari, NW Finland (LTSER)

abstract.para: Tree measurements, composition of vegetation and fungi, soil humidity and humus layer thickness were studied in a 5.5 ha plot in forest, which was burned in 1997 at Kolari, Finnish Lapland. Measurements before and after fire were carried out in 1997, 1998 and 2004. Aim of this study was to explore how forest fire affects in forest composition. Study was carried out by the Finnish Forest Research Institute (FFRI).

intellectualRights.para: Contact data-package owner for data before publishing.

contact.organizationName: Finnish Forest Research Institute (Metla), Kolari Research Unit

samplingDescription.para: The rescue department needed a place to practice fire extinguishing, which brought an opportunity to study effects of forest firein northern boreal forest. Forest was studied before fire in 1997 by recording tree measurements, vegetation composition, soil humidity and humus layer thickness. Next year same measurements were made and in addition fungi were studied. In 2004 vegetation composition and new tree seedling were recorded. Data package contains original measurements, maps, photos and plans for future studies. Data package and description is in Finnish only. Experimental plots are still available for further measurements by permission.
